alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 09 at 1:22PM MST until August 09 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of western and central Arizona. Including western Coconino, Yavapai, northern Gila, southern Navajo, and southern Apache counties. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Flash flooding will be possible in creeks, normally dry washes, swimming holes and over recently burned areas. Low-water crossings could also experience flash flooding, which would create deadly travel conditions. Consider changing your plans if you were going to hike, boat, or paddleboard to a slot canyon or normally dry wash. If you do still decide to recreate, check in at a nearby visitor center or ranger station. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Deep monsoon moisture in place across the region will lead to a round of widespread showers and thunderstorms capable of producing high rainfall rates. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Yavapai County Mountains
